bibl.title: Despatch from Albert Bushnell to William M. Evarts, January 23, 1878
Despatches from United States Consuls in Gaboon, 1856-1888 T-466

div1.p:
United States Commercial Agency at Gaboon.
January 23d 1878.

Hon William M. Evarts
Secretary of State,
Washington, D.C.

I have the honor to transmit herewith to the Department, copies of the action, recently taken by the Gaboon, and Corisco Mission, and the Corisco Presbytery; relating to a certain William Schorsch, who has threatened, I understand to complain of my action in his case. He has threatened the French Commandant in a similar manor.

As he was not an American citizen, I had no occasion to act officially in reference to him; and only acted with my associates, ecclesiastically, when duty demanded such cooperating. He has left Gaboon & gone to Corisco, a Spanish island, but still retains the hallucination, that he has a right to our property support &c.

I have the honor to be
Sir
Most Respectfully,
Your Obedient Servant,
Albert Bushnell
United S. Com. Agent

This petition respectfully represents that we request your Excellency's interference on our behalf against a certain Wilhelm Schorsch, at present living in the Gaboon jurisdictions. The said Wilhelm Schorsch, although not a naturalized American citizen, was formally an authorised member of our mission under the direction of the Presbyterian Board of Missions in America. But on account of his unquestioned insanity, he was recalled by the said Board and dismissed from its service. After partially recovering his health in an Insane Asylum in England, he has, on his own responsibility, returned to the Gaboon, against our protest, against the wish of the Board, and without its authority. We see already unmistakable indications of his continued insanity: Wherefore, we pray your immediate interference for our protection and relief.

And your petitioners will ever pray
R. H. Nassau Che. of Mission,
A. Bushnell, sec'y & Treasurer
C De Heer,
Saml H. Murphy.

Baraka, Gaboon W. A.
Monday January 7, 1878

And, Whereas:- He is now in the hands of the civil authorities of Gaboon, unable to meet with us, his violent conduct toward his missionary brethren having compelled civil proceedings against him; And Whereas;- that violent conduct,- slanderous language, and abusive manner have become so scandelous and immoral in their indirect and direct influence on his ministerial character, and so injurious to our mission work as to justify judicial proceedings by this Presbytery, and deposition from his ministerial office,- from which proceedings we however refrain, on the ground of his deranged mental condition making him not fully responsible,- Therefore, Resolved:-

That the said Mr Schorsch is unfit to exercise any ecclesiastical right or function, and that his name be dropped from the roll of this Presbytery unanimously carried by the affirmative votes on roll call of the entire Presbytery. Rev Messrs Bushnell, De Heer, Ibia, Murphy, Nassau, Elders Truman & Itongolo
(A true copy) R. H. Nassau S. C.
